subclusters.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and Molecular Damage Accumulation Theory
Evolutionary Disposable Soma Damage Accumulation Theory
Mitochondrial DNA Mutation-Driven Damage Accumulation Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and Molecular Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on stochastic molecular damage caused by ROS and reactive carbonyl species, emphasizing oxidative stress and antioxidant defenses.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and Molecular Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights free radical theory and accumulation of oxidative molecular and cellular damage leading to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and Molecular Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on oxidative damage from mitochondrial ROS and its role in aging, including antioxidant interventions.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and Molecular Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes oxidative stress as a driver of molecular damage accumulation and proteostasis loss.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and Molecular Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ROS accumulation, mitochondrial dysfunction, AGEs formation, and inflammation in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and Molecular Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes oxidative stress and ROS-induced molecular damage as key contributors to aging and lifespan differences.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and Molecular Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details ROS-induced damage to DNA, proteins, and membranes, including protein cross-linking and organ system vulnerability.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and Molecular Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Discusses accumulation of somatic damage including mitochondrial dysfunction and oxidative stress in neurodegeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and Molecular Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ROS and AGEs causing molecular damage accumulation and cellular senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and Molecular Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Includes oxidative damage by free radicals, cross-linking of macromolecules, and other molecular damage mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and Molecular Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes ROS-induced damage, protein modification, aggregation, and failure of maintenance mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Stress and Molecular Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights cumulative molecular damage, oxidative stress, inflammation, and insufficient repair in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: General Molecular Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Broadly describes accumulation of diverse molecular damages including mutations, epimutations, and organelle damage without specific focus on ROS.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: General Molecular Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation of molecular and cellular damage including oxidative stress and telomere degradation, emphasizing genetic and stochastic factors.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: General Molecular Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes cumulative cellular damage and discoordination of biochemical pathways leading to loss of cellular function.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: General Molecular Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes accumulation of diverse molecular and cellular damages represented by hallmarks of aging, with focus on geroprotectors.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: General Molecular Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on random molecular damage accumulation and declining repair efficiency forming an interconnected damage network.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: General Molecular Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes molecular damage accumulation including DNA mutations and protein instability leading to organismal decline.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: General Molecular Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Includes genetic and epigenetic alterations, oxidative stress, and stem cell exhaustion contributing to damage accumulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: General Molecular Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on DNA damage, protein damage, impaired proteostasis, and mitochondrial dysfunction as contributors to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: General Molecular Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes genomic alterations, mitochondrial dysfunction, loss of proteostasis, and abnormal crosslinking in musculoskeletal aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Disposable Soma Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on energy trade-offs between reproduction and maintenance leading to damage accumulation and aging, based on disposable soma theory.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Disposable Soma Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes aging as imbalance between stochastic damage and genetically controlled longevity assurance, emphasizing evolutionary trade-offs.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Evolutionary Disposable Soma Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on genomic instability induced by space radiation and ROS, with DNA repair limitations, framed in evolutionary context of damage accumulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation-Driven Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Centers on accumulation of somatic mtDNA mutations causing mitochondrial dysfunction and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation-Driven Damage Accumulation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS generation, mtDNA instability, and caretaker systems affecting mitochondrial function and aging.
